title: Add debug logging toggle to Settings General tab
description:
## Problem
Debug logging exists (logger.ts writes to /tmp/claude/bismarck-debug.log and plan-specific logs) but:
1. It's always enabled - no way to toggle it off/on
2. No UI to control it in production app
3. Logs don't include date/time in the log entries themselves

## Solution
Add debug logging settings to the General tab in Settings:

1. **Add to AppSettings interface** (settings-manager.ts):
   - `debug.enabled: boolean` - toggle logging on/off
   - `debug.logPath?: string` - optional custom path (default ~/.bismarck/debug.log)

2. **Update logger.ts**:
   - Check settings before writing to file
   - Add ISO timestamp to each log entry format
   - Current format: `[LEVEL] [category] message`
   - New format: `[2024-01-15T10:30:45.123Z] [LEVEL] [category] message`

3. **Add UI in GeneralSettings.tsx**:
   - Toggle switch for 'Enable debug logging'
   - Show current log file path
   - Optional: button to open log file location

4. **IPC handlers**:
   - Add `update-debug-settings` handler
   - Expose via preload API

## Notes
- Logger currently writes to /tmp/claude/bismarck-debug.log (volatile) 
- Consider moving default to ~/.bismarck/debug.log for persistence
- Follow existing patterns in SettingsPage.tsx for UI

title: Commits from headless agents use incorrect credentials causing unverified signatures
description:
Headless agents push commits with wrong user.name/user.email, causing GPG signatures to show as unverified on GitHub.

Example:
- Headless agent commit (unverified): https://github.com/cameronfleet-paxos/bismarck/commit/cc65f4ad57314c97b5e4f24c7bfd26c0c5a3276a
- User commit (verified): https://github.com/cameronfleet-paxos/bismarck/commit/80f929490d62702bd05b2cef5c15e1ddffa2eab9

GPG signing works via the tool proxy, but the username/email mismatch between the agent's git config and the GPG key causes commits to appear unverified.

Fix: Ensure headless agents inherit or use the correct git user.name and user.email from the parent environment or user config.

title: Add agent start/stop guidance to tutorial
description:
## Problem
The tutorial covers agent creation, tabs, command palette, attention, team mode, and settings - but doesn't explicitly guide users on how to start and stop agents.

## Current Tutorial Steps (7 total)
1. welcome - Intro modal
2. workspace - Create agents with '+' button
3. tabs - Tab organization
4. terminal - Command palette (Cmd+K)
5. attention - Yellow ring for waiting agents
6. team-mode - Plans (conditional on operating mode)
7. settings - Settings page

## Solution
Add new tutorial step(s) to guide users through:

### Option A: Extend existing steps
- Enhance 'workspace' step to mention stopping agents (close tab or right-click menu)
- Enhance 'terminal' step to highlight 'Start: Headless Agent' command specifically

### Option B: Add dedicated step (recommended)
Add new step after 'workspace' (position 3):
```typescript
{
  id: 'agent-lifecycle',
  title: 'Starting & Stopping Agents',
  description: 'To **start** a new agent, click the + button or use Cmd+K → Start: Headless Agent. To **stop** an agent, close its tab or right-click for options. Agents run independently and can be paused/resumed.',
  target: 'agents', // or new target for agent controls
  placement: 'right'
}
```

## Implementation
1. Edit `src/renderer/components/tutorial/tutorial-steps.ts`
2. Add new step definition with appropriate target
3. Consider adding `data-tutorial="agent-controls"` to relevant UI elements if needed
4. Test step progression and positioning

## Files to Modify
- src/renderer/components/tutorial/tutorial-steps.ts - add/modify step
- Potentially add data-tutorial attribute to agent control elements

title: Disable splash loading page in dev environment
description:
## Problem
The splash/loading screen appears during app startup even in development mode. This slows down the dev iteration cycle and is unnecessary when developing.

## Expected Behavior
- Production: Show splash screen during app initialization
- Development: Skip splash screen, go directly to main UI

## Implementation
Check for dev environment and conditionally skip splash:

```typescript
// Example pattern
const isDev = process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development' || \!app.isPackaged

if (isDev) {
  // Skip splash, load main UI directly
} else {
  // Show splash screen
}
```

## Files to Modify
- src/main/main.ts or wherever splash screen is triggered
- src/renderer/ - splash screen component (if conditional rendering needed)
- May involve window creation logic or initial route/state

## Notes
- `app.isPackaged` is a reliable way to detect production in Electron
- Could also check `process.env.NODE_ENV`
- Consider adding a flag to force splash in dev if needed for testing

title: Add crash log dump to ~/.bismarck for production errors
description:
## Problem
Currently, production errors in the Electron app are logged to console or /tmp/claude/bismarck-debug.log, but there's no persistent crash log that survives between sessions and is easily accessible for debugging.

## Solution
Create a dedicated crash log system that:
1. Catches errors from uncaughtException, unhandledRejection handlers in main.ts
2. Catches errors during headless agent loading (headless-agent.ts spawnContainerAgent)
3. Catches errors during app startup
4. Catches any renderer process errors forwarded via IPC

Each crash should be dumped to ~/.bismarck/crash-logs/ with filename format:
crash-YYYY-MM-DD_HH-mm-ss.log

## Implementation Notes
- Existing patterns: logger.ts already writes to ~/.bismarck for plan logs
- Global handlers exist in main.ts lines 199-216 (uncaughtException/unhandledRejection)
- Include stack trace, context (planId, taskId, agentId if available), timestamp
- Consider rotating/cleaning up old crash logs (e.g., keep last 50)

title: Add confirmation warning when reducing grid size
description:
## Problem
When reducing grid size (e.g., 2x2 → 1x1), agents that exceed the new capacity are silently affected. Users should be warned and given a chance to cancel or confirm.

## Expected Behavior
When user selects a smaller grid size:
1. Calculate how many agents will be affected per tab
2. Show confirmation dialog explaining:
   - Current grid: 2x2 (4 agents per tab)
   - New grid: 1x1 (1 agent per tab)
   - X agents will be stopped/redistributed
3. Options: 'Cancel' or 'Confirm & Redistribute'

## Implementation

### 1. GeneralSettings.tsx - Add confirmation logic
Before calling `setPreferences({ gridSize: newSize })`:
```typescript
const handleGridSizeChange = async (newSize: GridSize) => {
  const currentMax = getGridConfig(preferences.gridSize).maxAgents
  const newMax = getGridConfig(newSize).maxAgents
  
  if (newMax < currentMax) {
    // Count affected agents across all tabs
    const affectedCount = calculateAffectedAgents(tabs, currentMax, newMax)
    if (affectedCount > 0) {
      const confirmed = await showConfirmDialog({
        title: 'Reduce Grid Size?',
        message: `Changing from ${preferences.gridSize} to ${newSize} will affect ${affectedCount} agent(s). Only the first ${newMax} agent(s) per tab will be kept. Others will be stopped.`,
        confirmText: 'Confirm & Stop Agents',
        cancelText: 'Cancel'
      })
      if (\!confirmed) return
    }
  }
  
  await window.electronAPI.setPreferences({ gridSize: newSize })
}
```

### 2. Add confirmation dialog component or use existing pattern
- Check if there's an existing confirmation dialog in the codebase
- If not, create reusable ConfirmDialog component
- Should support: title, message, confirmText, cancelText, destructive styling

### 3. Backend handling (state-manager.ts)
When grid size reduces, the state manager should:
- Keep first N agents in each tab (where N = new maxAgents)
- Stop/cleanup excess agents
- Or move excess agents to overflow tabs

## Files to Modify
- src/renderer/components/settings/sections/GeneralSettings.tsx - confirmation logic
- src/renderer/components/ - ConfirmDialog component (if needed)
- src/main/state-manager.ts - handle agent redistribution on grid shrink
- src/shared/grid-utils.ts - may need helper for affected count

## Edge Cases
- Tab has 4 agents, grid goes 2x2 → 1x1: 3 agents affected
- Tab has 2 agents, grid goes 2x2 → 1x1: 1 agent affected
- Tab has 1 agent, grid goes 2x2 → 1x1: 0 agents affected
- Plan tabs may have different rules (unlimited?)

title: Fix Cmd+click file references in interactive agents
description:
## Problem
In interactive (non-headless) agent terminals, Cmd+click on file references does not work to open the file. This functionality appears to work (at least partially) in headless agents.

## Expected Behavior
Cmd+clicking on a file path reference (e.g., `src/main/main.ts:42`) should open the file in the system editor or file manager, consistent with headless agent behavior.

## Likely Cause
Different terminal components are used for interactive vs headless agents:
- Interactive: `Terminal.tsx` - uses xterm.js with WebLinksAddon
- Headless: `HeadlessTerminal.tsx` - has custom link handling

The link detection/handling logic may differ between these components.

## Investigation Points
1. Check `src/renderer/components/Terminal.tsx` - WebLinksAddon configuration
2. Check `src/renderer/components/HeadlessTerminal.tsx` - link handling (lines 66, 505, 680, 730 per earlier research)
3. Compare how file:// URLs and path patterns are detected and handled
4. Check if Cmd modifier key is being captured correctly in interactive terminals

## Files to Investigate/Modify
- src/renderer/components/Terminal.tsx - interactive terminal link handling
- src/renderer/components/HeadlessTerminal.tsx - working reference for link handling
- May involve xterm WebLinksAddon configuration or custom link provider

## Testing
1. Start an interactive agent
2. Have it reference a file path (e.g., `cat src/main/main.ts`)
3. Cmd+click on file path in output
4. Should open file - currently doesn't work
5. Compare same action in headless agent terminal

title: Clear focused agent when switching tabs to fix attention triggering
description:
## Problem
When focused on a terminal in one tab and then switching to another tab:
1. Focus remains on the agent from the previous tab (even though it's not visible)
2. If that agent has a notification/needs attention, the attention indicator won't trigger
3. User has to manually click on another agent to clear the stale focus

## Expected Behavior
When switching tabs:
1. Clear the focused agent (set to none/null)
2. If the previously focused agent has a pending notification, it should now trigger the attention indicator (yellow pulsing ring)
3. User can then use Cmd+N to cycle to waiting agents

## Root Cause (likely)
Tab switching logic doesn't call the focus clearing function. The attention system checks if an agent is focused before showing the attention indicator - if focused, it assumes user is already aware.

## Implementation
In tab switching handler:
```typescript
const handleTabSwitch = (newTabId: string) => {
  // Clear focused agent when leaving current tab
  setFocusedWorkspaceId(null)  // or equivalent
  
  // Switch to new tab
  setActiveTabId(newTabId)
  
  // Attention system will now correctly evaluate waiting agents
}
```

## Files to Modify
- src/renderer/App.tsx or TabBar.tsx - tab switching logic
- Check attention system logic to ensure it re-evaluates after focus clears

## Testing
1. Focus on an agent terminal in Tab A
2. Have that agent waiting for input (would normally trigger attention)
3. Switch to Tab B without clicking any agent
4. Verify: attention indicator should now show for the agent in Tab A
5. Cmd+N should cycle to the waiting agent

title: Add CDP integration tests for core UI flows
description:
Expand CDP test coverage beyond the existing tutorial tests to cover the core happy-path flows of the app. The CDP infrastructure (cdp-server.js, cdp-helper.js) already exists and is fast (~50ms per action) - it's just underutilized.

## Scope Warning
This is a BIG task. Pick this up only on a fresh iteration with full context budget - don't attempt it mid-session.

## Principles
- **All tests must pass** - no flaky or broken tests. If a test can't be made reliable, don't add it.
- **Readability first** - tests should read like documentation of what the app does. Prioritize clarity over cleverness.
- **Happy paths only** - we're not testing every edge case. Focus on the core flows a user would actually walk through.
- **No exhaustive coverage** - cover the important stuff well, not everything poorly.
- **Zero real API/token usage** - all agent interactions must be faked using the mock agent infrastructure (dev-test-harness, /mock-agent endpoint). Never spawn real Claude sessions. Tests must be safe to run repeatedly without burning tokens.

## Core flows to test
1. **Workspace view** - app loads, agents visible, can select/switch agents
2. **Settings page** - navigate to settings, verify sections render, toggle a setting
3. **Plan creation** - open plans panel, create a plan, verify it appears
4. **Headless agent UI** - spawn a mock agent via /mock-agent, verify terminal renders, status updates show (all faked, no real Claude calls)
5. **Keyboard shortcuts** - Cmd+K command palette opens/closes, Cmd+Shift+D dev console toggles

## Implementation notes
- Follow the pattern established in tutorial-test.js (test runner, timing, screenshots on failure)
- Add new test files alongside tutorial-test.js in scripts/test/
- Add npm scripts for running individual suites and all tests together
- Use /setup-test-env to bypass onboarding before each suite
- Use /mock-agent for any agent interaction tests - never real agent spawning

title: Add custom Ralph Loop preset prompts with import/export
description:
## Overview
Allow users to create, save, and share custom Ralph Loop preset prompts (similar to how the 'Complete All Beads Tasks' preset works).

## Current State
- Built-in presets defined in `src/shared/ralph-loop-presets.ts` (complete-beads, custom)
- No way to save custom presets
- No import/export functionality
- Settings already have prompts section for orchestrator/planner/discussion/task

## Solution

### 1. Settings Schema Extension (settings-manager.ts)
Add to AppSettings:
```typescript
ralphLoopPresets: {
  custom: RalphLoopPreset[]  // User-created presets
}
```

### 2. Settings UI - New Section
Add 'Ralph Loop Presets' section in Settings (could be under Plans or new tab):
- List of user-created presets with edit/delete buttons
- 'Add New Preset' button opens editor
- Each preset shows: name, description, model, max iterations
- Import from JSON button (from clipboard)
- Export to JSON button (to clipboard)

### 3. Preset Editor Modal
Similar to PromptEditor but for full RalphLoopPreset:
- Label input
- Description input
- Prompt textarea (large)
- Completion phrase input
- Max iterations slider
- Model selector (opus/sonnet)
- Save / Cancel buttons

### 4. Save from Ralph Loop Dialog (CommandSearch.tsx)
In mode 3 (configuration), add:
- 'Save as Preset' button next to Start Loop
- Opens preset editor pre-filled with current values
- Saves to settings.ralphLoopPresets.custom

### 5. Preset Selection Enhancement
Modify preset buttons in CommandSearch to:
- Show built-in presets first (Complete Beads, Custom)
- Show user presets below with different styling
- User presets can be deleted (X button on hover)

### 6. Import/Export
- Export: JSON.stringify preset → navigator.clipboard.writeText
- Import: navigator.clipboard.readText → JSON.parse → validate → add to list
- Validation: check required fields (id, label, prompt, completionPhrase, etc.)

## Files to Modify
- src/main/settings-manager.ts - schema, load/save functions
- src/shared/ralph-loop-presets.ts - combine built-in + user presets
- src/renderer/components/CommandSearch.tsx - save preset button, enhanced selector
- src/renderer/components/settings/sections/ - new RalphLoopPresetsSettings.tsx
- src/main/main.ts - IPC handlers for preset CRUD
- src/main/preload.ts - expose preset APIs

## IPC Handlers Needed
- get-ralph-presets → returns merged built-in + custom
- add-ralph-preset → adds to custom list
- update-ralph-preset → updates existing custom
- delete-ralph-preset → removes from custom list

title: Fix grid size not updating tab capacity display
description: ## Problem When changing grid size in Settings (e.g., from 2x2 to 2x3), the tabs still show `4/4` instead of `4/6`. The backend logic is correct but the frontend TabBar has hardcoded values. ## Root Cause Multiple hardcoded '4' values in TabBar.tsx that don't read the gridSize preference: ### Issue 1: Display text (TabBar.tsx:166) ```tsx {`(${agentCount}/4)`} // Always shows /4 ``` ### Issue 2: Drop capacity check (TabBar.tsx:81) ```tsx const canAcceptDrop = ... && (tab.isPlanTab || agentCount < 4) // Hardcoded to 4 ``` ### Issue 3: repo-grouper.ts (lines 226, 234) Multiple hardcoded `4` values for overflow/chunking logic. ## Correct Implementation Exists The main process has the correct pattern in state-manager.ts: ```typescript function getMaxAgentsPerTab(): number { return getGridConfig(currentState.preferences.gridSize).maxAgents } ``` Grid configs in grid-utils.ts map correctly: - 1x1 → maxAgents: 1 - 2x2 → maxAgents: 4 - 2x3 → maxAgents: 6 - 3x3 → maxAgents: 9 ## Fix Required 1. Pass `gridSize` (or `maxAgents`) to TabBar component as prop 2. Replace hardcoded '4' with dynamic value from `getGridConfig(gridSize).maxAgents` 3. Update repo-grouper.ts to use dynamic capacity ## Files to Modify - src/renderer/components/TabBar.tsx - lines 81, 166 - src/renderer/App.tsx - pass gridSize/maxAgents prop to TabBar - src/main/repo-grouper.ts - lines 226, 234 ## Testing 1. Set grid to 2x3 in Settings 2. Tab should show `X/6` not `X/4` 3. Should be able to drag 6 agents into a tab 4. Set grid to 1x1, should show `X/1` and reject drops at 1

title: Add 'Discuss: Headless Agent' command with auto-start
description:
## Overview
Add a new command that starts a discussion session focused on gathering requirements, then automatically spawns a standalone headless agent with the discussion output.

## Key Differences from Plan Discussion
- **No task creation focus** - purely requirement gathering and clarification
- **Configurable max questions** - setting to limit discussion length (e.g., 5-10 questions)
- **Auto-starts headless agent** - no manual step after discussion completes
- **Discussion panel disappears** - seamless transition to headless agent

## Implementation

### 1. New Prompt Template (prompt-templates.ts)
Create `HEADLESS_DISCUSSION_PROMPT` that:
- Focuses on requirements gathering, architecture decisions, edge cases
- Does NOT mention task breakdown or beads
- Has configurable `{{maxQuestions}}` placeholder
- Writes output to a temp file when complete
- Uses AskUserQuestion tool for structured Q&A

### 2. Command Registration (CommandSearch.tsx)
Add new command:
```typescript
{ id: 'start-headless-discussion', label: 'Discuss: Headless Agent', icon: MessageSquare }
```

### 3. Discussion Flow (new file or extend standalone-headless.ts)
- `startHeadlessDiscussion(referenceAgentId, maxQuestions)`
- Creates temporary discussion workspace
- Injects headless discussion prompt
- Watches for completion (output file written)
- On completion: closes discussion, starts headless agent with output as context

### 4. Settings (optional)
Add `headlessDiscussion.maxQuestions: number` to AppSettings (default: 7)

### 5. UI Components
- Reuse existing discussion terminal display
- Add modal/dialog for max questions config before starting
- Show transition indicator when switching to headless agent

## Completion Detection
Similar to plan discussion - watch for output file write, then:
1. Read discussion output
2. Close discussion workspace
3. Call `startStandaloneHeadlessAgent()` with discussion output prepended to prompt

## Files to Modify
- src/main/prompt-templates.ts - new prompt
- src/renderer/components/CommandSearch.tsx - new command
- src/main/standalone-headless.ts - discussion flow
- src/main/main.ts - IPC handlers
- src/main/preload.ts - expose API
- src/main/settings-manager.ts - optional max questions setting

title: Bug: Debug logging should use date-based rolling log files
description: When debug logging is enabled, log files should roll based on date/timestamp rather than growing indefinitely. E.g. debug-2026-02-06.log, debug-2026-02-07.log. This prevents single log files from growing unbounded and makes it easier to find logs for a specific day.

title: Bug: Persona changes don't apply in installed app but work in dev
description: Changing persona in the installed app (writes to ~/.bismarck) doesn't seem to take effect. However when running in dev mode (writes to ~/.bismarck-dev) the persona change applies correctly. Unclear if the issue is: (1) the installed app not reading/writing persona config correctly, (2) something about having dev mode booted interfering, or (3) a path resolution issue between prod and dev config directories. Needs investigation.

title: Document required GitHub token permissions

title: Attention mode in expand flickers on/off rapidly

title: Wizard: Display agent descriptions in 2-column grid
